title: 2 students pushing a box - motion graph

content.description: Two students need to move two identical boxes of mass <math alttext="M sub 0" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><msub><mi>M</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> across a room where friction between the floor and the boxes cannot be neglected. One student moves the first box by pushing with a force of magnitude <math alttext="F sub 0" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> at an angle <math alttext="theta" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>θ</mi></math> from the horizontal, as shown in the figure for scenario 1. The other student moves the second box by pulling with a force of magnitude <math alttext="F sub 0" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> at the same angle <math alttext="theta" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>θ</mi></math> from the horizontal, as shown in the figure for scenario 2.
content.question: Which of the following graphs could describe the motion of the two boxes as they are moved across the room?

choices.label: The figure shows the graph of 2 lines in the first quadrant of a coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The horizontal axis is labeled “Time,” and the vertical axis is labeled “Speed.” The first line represents Scenario 1. It begins at the origin and moves steadily upward and to the right until it ends. The second line represents Scenario 2. It begins at the origin and moves more gradually upward and to the right until it ends.

The figure shows the graph of 2 lines in the first quadrant of a coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The horizontal axis is labeled “Time,” and the vertical axis is labeled “Speed.” The first line represents Scenario 1. It begins about one third of the way up the vertical axis and moves horizontally to the right until it ends. The second line represents Scenario 2. It begins on the vertical axis about halfway between the horizontal axis and where the line for scenario 1 begins. It moves horizontally to the right until it ends.

The figure shows a graph of 2 lines in the first quadrant of a coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The horizontal axis is labeled “Time,” and the vertical axis is labeled “Speed.” The first line represents Scenario 1. It begins on the vertical axis, just above the origin, and moves horizontally to the right until it ends. The second line represents Scenario 2. It begins at the same point as the line for scenario 1, and moves gradually upward and to the right until it ends.

The figure shows the graph of 2 lines in the first quadrant of a coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The horizontal axis is labeled “Time,” and the vertical axis is labeled “Speed.” The first line represents Scenario 1. It begins about one fifth of the way up the vertical axis and moves horizontally to the right until it ends. The second line represents Scenario 2. It begins about three fifths of the way up the vertical axis and moves horizontally to the right until it ends.

content.answer: The figure shows a graph of 2 lines in the first quadrant of a coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The horizontal axis is labeled “Time,” and the vertical axis is labeled “Speed.” The first line represents Scenario 1. It begins on the vertical axis, just above the origin, and moves horizontally to the right until it ends. The second line represents Scenario 2. It begins at the same point as the line for scenario 1, and moves gradually upward and to the right until it ends.

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
